DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Effects Study Medication Exercise Function Type 2 Diabetes
DOC.criteria: Sedentary adult participate regular exercise program ( ≤ one bout schedule exercise per week ) Subjects must Type 2 Diabetes Subjects must otherwise healthy Ages 3060 year BMI 2539 stable weight 3 month prior start study Diabetes control diet +/ insulin secretagogues ( sulfonylureas glinides ) , metformin , glucose absorption blocker ( acarbose ) . Total glycosylated hemoglobin level ( HbA1C ) ≤9 % ( fair control ) current therapy . Any comorbid condition could limit exercise performance include Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD ) asthma Concurrent enrollment interventional study . Any tobacco use either current within last year Clinically evident distal symmetrical neuropathy , determine evaluation symptom ( numbness , paresthesia ) sign ( elicit vibration , pinprick , light touch , ankle jerk ) , exclude . Autonomic dysfunction ( > 20 mm fall upright BP without change heart rate ) exclude . Evidence ischemic heart disease history abnormal resting exercise electrocardiogram ( EKG ) ( > 1 mm ST segment depression ) screening exercise test . Angina cardiovascular , pulmonary musculoskeletal symptom Presence systolic blood pressure > 190 rest > 250 exercise diastolic pressure > 95 rest > 105 exercise Proteinuria ( urine protein > 200 mg/dl ) creatinine > 2 mg/dl , suggestive severe renal disease Proliferative retinopathy Insulin , incretin , glitazone treatment Niacin treatment History peptic ulcer A history hereditary angioedema C1 esterase deficiency Women pregnant breastfeeding Use fibrate drug
